content:
Diagnosis:	Invasive lobular carcinoma of left breast, grade 2, pT3pN2M0 (6/15 nodes), ER/PR strongly positive, HER2 negative.

Initial treatment with mastectomy and axillary clearance March 2023, followed by adjuvant FEC-T chemotherapy completed September 2023. Currently on letrozole and zolendronic acid.

Solitary bone metastasis in L3 vertebra identified on routine follow-up CT December 2023, treated with stereotactic radiotherapy 24Gy in 3 fractions January 2024.

[redacted name] attended today for review of response to radiotherapy and ongoing hormone therapy. She reports good improvement in her back pain following radiotherapy, now only requiring occasional paracetamol. Performance status remains 0. She is tolerating letrozole well with only mild arthralgias managed with regular exercise.

CT scan last week shows stable appearance of the L3 lesion post-radiotherapy with no evidence of new metastatic disease. Blood tests show normal liver and renal function, with stable tumor markers.

On examination today, she has good range of movement in her spine with no focal tenderness. Mastectomy site remains well healed with no evidence of local recurrence.

Plan is to continue current hormone therapy with letrozole and 3-monthly zolendronic acid. Will arrange repeat CT chest/abdomen/pelvis in 3 months and review in clinic with results. She understands to contact us sooner if new symptoms develop.
